gurmukhi: pMQ inhwrq nYnn kI kib sXwm khY puqrI doaU hwrI ]aUDv sXwm soXo khIXo qumry ibnu BI sB gÍwr ibcwrI ]965]
transliteration: Panth Nihaarat Nainan Kikabi Syaam Kahai Poutridooo Hdaree|| Oodhav Syaam Soyo Kaheeyo Toumre Bin(u) Bhisabh Gvaar Bichdaree||965||
translation: “ ‘Our eyes are feeling tired on looking for the arrival of Krishna; O Udhava ! tell Krishna that without you all the gopis have become helpless.965.

gurmukhi: Aaur khI qum sO hir jU biRKBwn suqw qum ko joaU pXwrI ]jw idn qy biRj qXwg gey idn qw kI nhI hmhU hY sMBwrI ]
transliteration: Aur Kahitoum Sau Har(i) Joo Brikhbhaan Soutaa Toum Ko Jooo Pydaree|| Jaa Din Te Brij Tyaag Gad Din Taa Kinahihamhoo Hai Sanbhdaree||
translation: “ ‘O Krishna ! Your dear Radha has said that she has not been able to control herself since the day when you left Braja;

gurmukhi: Awvhu qXwg AbY mQurw qRmry ibn gI Ab hoie ibcwrI ]mY qum isau hir mwn krXo qj Awvhu mwn AbY hm hwrI ]966]
transliteration: Oovoh Tyaag Abai Mathuraa Toumre Bin Giab Hoe Bichdaree|| Mai Toum Sio Har(i) Maan Daryo Taj Aavoh Maan Abai Ham Hdaree966||
translation: “ ‘You may come, leaving Mathura immediately, we are helpless without you; I had been very egoistic with you, come to me, I accept defeat.966.

gurmukhi: qXwg gey hmko ikh hyq qy bwq kCU qumrI n ibgwrI ]pwien mo pr kY sunIXY pRB ey bqIXw ieh BwNq aucwrI ]
transliteration: Tyaag Gad Hamko Kih Het Te Baat Kachhodh Toumrina Bigdaree|| Paain Mo Par Kai Souneeyai Prabh E Bateeyaa Eh Bhaant Ouchdaree||
translation: “ ‘We had not harmed you in any way, why have you forsaken us? O Lord ! falling at my feet Radha said this:

gurmukhi: Awp rcy pur bwsn soN mn qy sBhI biRjnwr ibswrI ]mwn krXo qum so Gt kwm krXo Ab sXwm hhw hm hwrI ]967]
transliteration: Oop Rache Pur Baasan Son Man Te Sabh-hibrijnaar Bisdaree|| Maan Daryo Toum So Ghat Kaam Daryo Ab Syaam Hahaa Ham Hdaree||967||
translation: “ ‘O Krishna ! you have absorbed yourself with the residents of the city, forgetting the women of Braja; O Krishna ! we had shown persistence towards you, but now we feel defeated.’967.

gurmukhi: Aaur krI qum so ibnqI soaU sXwm khY icq dY suin lIjY ]Kylq QI qum dso bn mY qih Aausr ik kbhUM suD kIjY ]
transliteration: Aur Karitoum So Bintisooo Syaam Kahai Chit Dai Soun(i) Leejai|| Khelat Thitoum So Ban Mai Tih Aousar Kikab-hoon Sadh Keejai||
translation: “They have further said this thing to you, ‘O Krishna ! listen to it with all your heart; we used to play with you some time; O Krishna ! do remember that occasion some time;

gurmukhi: gwvq QI qum pY iml kY ijh kI sur qy kCu qwn n CIjY ]qwko khXo iqh kI suD kY bhuro biRj bwsn ko suK dIjY ]968]
transliteration: Gadvat Thitoum Pai Mil Kai Jih Kisur Te Kachh(u) Taan Na Chheejai|| Taako Kahyo Tih Kisudh Kai Bahuro Brij Baasan Ko Soukh Deejai||968||
translation: “ ‘We used to sing with you in a lengthened tune; we have asked you to remember all this; O Krishna ! communicate again with the residents of Braja.968.

gurmukhi: Aaur khI biRKBwn suqw hir jU soaU bwq AbY suin l`eIXY ]XO khXo qXwg qumY mQurw bhuro biRj kuMjn BIqr A`eIXY ]
transliteration: Aur Kahibrikhbhaan Soutaa Har(i) Joo Sooo Baat Abai Soun(i) Laeeeeyai|| Yaoun Kahyo Tyaag Toumai Mathuraa Bahuro Brij Kounjan Bheetar Aeeeeyai||
translation: “Listen further; Radha said, ‘Leave Mathura and come into the alcoves of Braja,

gurmukhi: ijau hmry sMg Kylq Qy iqh BwNq khXo iPir Kyl mc`eIXY ]cwh GnI quih dyKn kI giH Awie khXo hmko suK d`eIXY ]969]
transliteration: Jio Hamre San Khelat The Tih Bhaant Khyo Phir(i) Khel Machaeeeeyai|| Chaah Ghanituh(i) Dekhan Kigadh(i) Aae Kahyo Hamko Soukh Daeeeeyai||969||
translation: “ ‘And proclaim loudly about the amorous play as you had been doing earlier; O Krishna ! the desire of seeing you is getting powerful; kindly come and give happiness to us.969.

gurmukhi: qyry ipKy ibn hy hir jI khI BwNq khXo nhIN mo mn BIjY ]sUk BeI puqrI sI khXo khI XoN hir so ibnqI sun lIjY ]
transliteration: Dere Pikhe Bin He Har(i) Jikahibhant Kahyo Naheen Mo Man Bheejai|| Sook Bhaipoutrisikahyo Yon Har(i) So Bintisoun Leejai||
translation: “ ‘O Krishna, my mind is in anguish without seeing you;’ Radha has withered away and has become slim and she has said;
